GT.content: Derrida links pheuin, phusis to donation, thus bringing nature & production together [sometimes opposed]; fortune (fate, chance, fors, luck, fortuity) and necessity are allied
GT.linkedContent: Derrida links pheuin, phusis to donation, thus bringing nature & production together [sometimes opposed]; fortune (fate, chance, fors, luck, fortuity) and necessity are allied

GT.content: playing w/ fors, fortuna, ferre (fer, ferre; in Greek, pherô) which means to bear, & fero, “I report,” counterfeit money carries us to heart of question of reference & difference,
GT.linkedContent: playing w/ fors, fortuna, ferre (fer, ferre; in Greek, pherô) which means to bear, & fero, “I report,” counterfeit money carries us to heart of question of reference & difference,

GT.content: dematerialization of money [late capitalism], can one quote money? fors, fortuna: Baudelaire reserves status of absolute exception for money (not the gift)
GT.linkedContent: dematerialization of money [late capitalism], can one quote money? fors, fortuna: Baudelaire reserves status of absolute exception for money (not the gift)

GT.content: social function of beggar, madman: “the pocket of an indispensable internal exclusion,” like structure of pharmakos, incorporation w/out introjection (assimilation), an identity by exclusion, keeps outside w/in, l’exception faite (fors) d’une clôture ou d’un clivage intérieur
GT.linkedContent: social function of beggar, madman: “the pocket of an indispensable internal exclusion,” like structure of pharmakos, incorporation w/out introjection (assimilation), an identity by exclusion, keeps outside w/in, l’exception faite (fors) d’une clôture ou d’un clivage intérieur

LOBL.linkedContent: for intérieur (“conscience,” “inner tribunal,” “heart of hearts”), crypt

PAS.content: nothing presents itself [in approach of “terrifyingly ancient,” terrifyingly becoming “subject” not accessory adverb], fors l’obscène (save the obscene), what awaits as forgetting
PAS.linkedContent: nothing presents itself [in approach of “terrifyingly ancient,” terrifyingly becoming “subject” not accessory adverb], fors l’obscène (save the obscene), what awaits as forgetting

F.content: Abraham & Torok: [Wolf Man’s] jouissance jealously preserved (gardée) in his inner safe (for)
F.linkedContent: Abraham & Torok: [Wolf Man’s] jouissance jealously preserved (gardée) in his inner safe (for)

F.content: crypt, an enclosure, history of an enclave, architecture, open square w/in space, secret interior w/in public square, a closure, a safe (for) in a forum (where free circulation of objects & speech occurs)
F.linkedContent: crypt, an enclosure, history of an enclave, architecture, open square w/in space, secret interior w/in public square, a closure, a safe (for) in a forum (where free circulation of objects & speech occurs)

F.content: hermetically sealed? yes and no [see SH p. 61], “je” ne sauve un for intérieur qu’en le mettant en “moi”, à part moi, dehors
F.linkedContent: hermetically sealed? yes and no [see SH p. 61], “je” ne sauve un for intérieur qu’en le mettant en “moi”, à part moi, dehors

F.content: forums are politico-juridical instances, require a third, a witness (like a duel), tribunal instruisant un procès, mettant en cause
F.linkedContent: forums are politico-juridical instances, require a third, a witness (like a duel), tribunal instruisant un procès, mettant en cause

F.content: le for du dedans (not intérieur) is not le tribunal de la conscience (“jury box” of consciousness) even though enclosed w/in forum of self > it is the contradiction w/ in desire [?]
F.linkedContent: le for du dedans (not intérieur) is not le tribunal de la conscience (“jury box” of consciousness) even though enclosed w/in forum of self > it is the contradiction w/ in desire [?]

F.content: crypt is a parasite inclusion/internalization, an inside heterogenous to inside of Self, an outcast in domain of introjection w/in which it violently takes its place, le for cryptique entretiens dans la répétition the mortal conflict it is impotent to resolve
F.linkedContent: crypt is a parasite inclusion/internalization, an inside heterogenous to inside of Self, an outcast in domain of introjection w/in which it violently takes its place, le for cryptique entretiens dans la répétition the mortal conflict it is impotent to resolve

F.content: incorporation (magic, secret, cryptic, instantaneous) seals loss of object, the dead, an exquisite corpse, loves the dead safe (save) inside me, as dead; introjection (slow, gradual, laborious, effective) dead save in me as living, enlarge the self (introj. as normal mourning)
F.linkedContent: incorporation (magic, secret, cryptic, instantaneous) seals loss of object, the dead, an exquisite corpse, loves the dead safe (save) inside me, as dead; introjection (slow, gradual, laborious, effective) dead save in me as living, enlarge the self (introj. as normal mourning)

F.content: how to treat introj./incorp.: rigorous dissociation even if purity of dissociation remains theoretical: dissociation as excluding inclusion of one safe in another (d’un for dans l’autre)
F.linkedContent: how to treat introj./incorp.: rigorous dissociation even if purity of dissociation remains theoretical: dissociation as excluding inclusion of one safe in another (d’un for dans l’autre)

F.content: topography of forum fragmented by secret—[its ‘lashing out’]
F.linkedContent: topography of forum fragmented by secret—[its ‘lashing out’]

F.content: crypt, pocket of resistance, le for le plus intérieur (la crypte comme inconscience artificiel, comme artefact du Moi) devient le hormis (excepté, sauf, fors) > dizzying topology of inside/outside
F.linkedContent: crypt, pocket of resistance, le for le plus intérieur (la crypte comme inconscience artificiel, comme artefact du Moi) devient le hormis (excepté, sauf, fors) > dizzying topology of inside/outside

F.content: self does identify, to resist introjection: but only in “imaginary, occult” way; the “endocryptic identification” designed to keep topography intact and the place safe (le lieu sauf) are cryptofantasmatic, but the inclusion, divisions and partitions are real
F.linkedContent: self does identify, to resist introjection: but only in “imaginary, occult” way; the “endocryptic identification” designed to keep topography intact and the place safe (le lieu sauf) are cryptofantasmatic, but the inclusion, divisions and partitions are real

F.content: la topique des fors (the topography of safes) donne à penser, along w/ thought of crypt, the beyond-place (hors-lieu) or no-place (non-lieu), il faut garder sauf (hormis, exception faite, fors) in no-place the other place
F.linkedContent: la topique des fors (the topography of safes) donne à penser, along w/ thought of crypt, the beyond-place (hors-lieu) or no-place (non-lieu), il faut garder sauf (hormis, exception faite, fors) in no-place the other place

F.content: topography of crypt follows fracture line from no-place/beyond-place to other place: where “pleasure’s death,” marks the singular pleasure: sauf
F.linkedContent: topography of crypt follows fracture line from no-place/beyond-place to other place: where “pleasure’s death,” marks the singular pleasure: sauf

F.content: otherness before opposition btwn introj./incorp. not the contradiction of telos of Aufhebung, but undecidable irresolution: paradoxically incorp. doesn’t preserve other [garde une topique, mantient sauve], introj. more open [to other] > makes it impossible for the 2 to close over their proper, their death, their corpse
F.linkedContent: otherness before opposition btwn introj./incorp. not the contradiction of telos of Aufhebung, but undecidable irresolution: paradoxically incorp. doesn’t preserve other [garde une topique, mantient sauve], introj. more open [to other] > makes it impossible for the 2 to close over their proper, their death, their corpse

F.content: crypt is catastrophe, catastrophe’s monument (forum is that which attempts to prevent catastrophe); but in trying to destroy it [crypt?], it is consolidated: this is the catastrophe
F.linkedContent: crypt is catastrophe, catastrophe’s monument (forum is that which attempts to prevent catastrophe); but in trying to destroy it [crypt?], it is consolidated: this is the catastrophe

F.content: crypt constructed by its very ruin, held up by what saps it > in its contradiction, coffre-fort [fors] and ceaseless instability
F.linkedContent: crypt constructed by its very ruin, held up by what saps it > in its contradiction, coffre-fort [fors] and ceaseless instability

F.content: the Thing is encrypted by crypt (for du Moi, self’s safe) not w/in (dans) it; crypted structure of ultimate referent [Thing] means double articulation (history, story) coalesces all these genres: myth, poem, novel, drama, translation > the narrated event never appears
F.linkedContent: the Thing is encrypted by crypt (for du Moi, self’s safe) not w/in (dans) it; crypted structure of ultimate referent [Thing] means double articulation (history, story) coalesces all these genres: myth, poem, novel, drama, translation > the narrated event never appears

F.content: steps “to the fore” [in English]
F.linkedContent: steps “to the fore” [in English]

F.content: tombstone is “illicit,” marks extreme jouissance, attempt to break in [analyze] isn’t illegal, a market is organized around crypt, when introjection is thwarted > evaluates rates (taux) of pleasure (jouissance) & pain (forum or for, la place de marché, fur

F.content: Abraham and Torok decipher a story that was its own ciphering, tell the story of a story, from one word, one safe (for), to another
F.linkedContent: Abraham and Torok decipher a story that was its own ciphering, tell the story of a story, from one word, one safe (for), to another

F.content: proper name: multiple economy of places, instances & safes (fors)
F.linkedContent: proper name: multiple economy of places, instances & safes (fors)

ROP.content: qui, fors Dieu, a jamais créé, ce qui s’appelle créé, un concept?
ROP.linkedContent: qui, fors Dieu, a jamais créé, ce qui s’appelle créé, un concept?

DPi.content: Hugo (conscious of historical responsibility of writer/literature): writers of 18th century destroyed torture; writers of 19th century will destroy DP; p. 104 destroy it w/ divine hammer of pen > profoundly Christian stance, btwn profound flourish & faith, for intérieur
DPi.linkedContent: Hugo (conscious of historical responsibility of writer/literature): writers of 18th century destroyed torture; writers of 19th century will destroy DP; p. 104 destroy it w/ divine hammer of pen > profoundly Christian stance, btwn profound flourish & faith, for intérieur

C.content: excess zeal, the little one (paradigm) built like a crypt [Lacan’s objet a?], jealously keeps its secret at moment of greatest exhibition
C.linkedContent: excess zeal, the little one (paradigm) built like a crypt [Lacan’s objet a?], jealously keeps its secret at moment of greatest exhibition

C.content: hermetically closed (portable temples called hermes): mute beneath its altuglassed transparency, seduces, attracts the dead man, makes him come back and more: fors in that casket
C.linkedContent: hermetically closed (portable temples called hermes): mute beneath its altuglassed transparency, seduces, attracts the dead man, makes him come back and more: fors in that casket

C.content: coffin, as the odd, as the remainder, remains entire, divisible only by itself [prime: 127], as long as you deduct one—the paradigm coffin: belongs w/out belonging to series it makes possible > inscribes itself in series, leaves on it mark of its own subtraction
C.linkedContent: coffin, as the odd, as the remainder, remains entire, divisible only by itself [prime: 127], as long as you deduct one—the paradigm coffin: belongs w/out belonging to series it makes possible > inscribes itself in series, leaves on it mark of its own subtraction

C.content: transcendental mors, fors, exceptional piece; (fait) band à part (has a hard-on, keeps aloof)
C.linkedContent: transcendental mors, fors, exceptional piece; (fait) band à part (has a hard-on, keeps aloof)

C.content: le M’hors-serie (I’m-out-of-series), Fors-series, the excluded necessary that marks the border of the Necessary itself: the necessary, the excepted, the contingent, sauf, fors
C.linkedContent: le M’hors-serie (I’m-out-of-series), Fors-series, the excluded necessary that marks the border of the Necessary itself: the necessary, the excepted, the contingent, sauf, fors

C.content: coffin’s mutism: always a box in a box, some supplementary cartridge, a parergon > hors la boîte, fors la boîte: necessity to steal coffin (each time, differently) inscribed right on the “thing,” right on the cartouche [congenital perjury of justice]
C.linkedContent: coffin’s mutism: always a box in a box, some supplementary cartridge, a parergon > hors la boîte, fors la boîte: necessity to steal coffin (each time, differently) inscribed right on the “thing,” right on the cartouche [congenital perjury of justice]

C.content: date as place of crypt, stands in for it, only one that remains; why do I date? throw of a die: no one will know what was lived on the date (what was taken away), save (fors) the heart
C.linkedContent: date as place of crypt, stands in for it, only one that remains; why do I date? throw of a die: no one will know what was lived on the date (what was taken away), save (fors) the heart

TN.content: intruder on inside, constitutively haunted by some hetero-affection related to spacing, a host, a parasite, pharmakon, ghost: [each of these figures] habite en revenant tout for intérieur (inhabit one’s heart of hearts as a ghost)
TN.linkedContent: intruder on inside, constitutively haunted by some hetero-affection related to spacing, a host, a parasite, pharmakon, ghost: [each of these figures] habite en revenant tout for intérieur (inhabit one’s heart of hearts as a ghost)

CIN.content: “l’incinéré n’est plus rien fors la cendre [innermost cinder furnace], un reste qui se doit de ne plus rester, ce lieu de rien qui soit, un lieu pur se chiffrât-il [marked out]” > there are cinders, what takes place in letting a place occur
CIN.linkedContent: “l’incinéré n’est plus rien fors la cendre [innermost cinder furnace], un reste qui se doit de ne plus rester, ce lieu de rien qui soit, un lieu pur se chiffrât-il [marked out]” > there are cinders, what takes place in letting a place occur

CIN.content: nothing out of reach of the tongue of fire (langue de feu), not even cinders if there are cinders there, save a chance (fors une chance)
CIN.linkedContent: nothing out of reach of the tongue of fire (langue de feu), not even cinders if there are cinders there, save a chance (fors une chance)

SPEC.content: no one demands to know what devil thinks dans son for intérieur, Freud can think the devil w/out putting himself on the devil’s side (no written promise/contract w/ devil)
SPEC.linkedContent: no one demands to know what devil thinks dans son for intérieur, Freud can think the devil w/out putting himself on the devil’s side (no written promise/contract w/ devil)
